article.writingAngle: Complete transportation chain from farm to destination - covering harvesting, loading, storage conditions, transport modes, and delivery

company.name: Soontact Intelligent Equipment
company.coreBusiness: Design, manufacturing, and distribution of automated packaging solutions for global markets. With 30 years of experience, Soontact provides comprehensive packaging machinery from single machines to complete production line systems.
company.valueProposition: A trusted global partner in automated packaging machinery, emphasizing reliability, customization, and comprehensive support. In-house R&D, manufacturing, and support operations ensure quality control and responsive customer service.

audience.description: New production managers, small food business owners, entrepreneurs considering automation, students studying packaging
audience.industry: New production managers, small food business owners, entrepreneurs considering automation, students studying packaging

goals.primary: Understand packaging automation basics; evaluate if automation is right for their business; learn terminology

alreadyKnows: Machines exist that can automate packaging
Basic awareness of different package types (bags, boxes, pouches)
needsToLearn: Types of packaging machines and their applications
Basic packaging terminology (VFFS, flow wrap, etc.)
How to evaluate packaging solutions for their products

typicalQuestions: What is a flow packaging machine?

writingApproach.style: Conversational; use analogies and real-world examples
writingApproach.complexity: Simple sentences; define all jargon; avoid acronyms or explain them immediately
writingApproach.structure: Start with 'why it matters'; build concepts step-by-step
writingApproach.wordChoice: Everyday language; assume no prior knowledge

do: Use everyday analogies: 'A flow wrapper works like gift-wrapping a present, but at high speed...'
Show practical examples: 'For example, the granola bars you see at the store...'
Connect concepts to familiar products they use daily
dont: Assume knowledge of packaging industry terms
Use unexplained acronyms (VFFS, HFFS, OPP, etc.)
Present too many machine types at once without clear categorization

userContext.situation: Curious about food supply chain logistics, possibly researching for business planning, academic work, or general interest in how produce reaches consumers
userContext.currentState: Has limited understanding of agricultural logistics; may know potatoes come from farms but unclear on the journey between harvest and store shelf
userContext.desiredState: Clear mental picture of the complete potato transportation chain, understanding key stages, conditions required, and methods used

searchIntent.coreQuestion: What are the steps and methods involved in transporting potatoes from farms to their final destination?
implicitQuestions: How are potatoes protected from damage during transport?
What temperature and storage conditions do potatoes need?
How long can potatoes be transported before spoiling?
What vehicles or containers are used for potato transport?
Are there special handling requirements for potatoes?
searchIntent.successCriteria: Reader can explain the basic potato transportation journey from farm to destination, naming key stages and understanding why proper handling matters

goldenInsights.insight: Bruising costs U.S. potato industry $298 million annually
Rail is 10x more efficient than trucks - 1,000 miles by rail equals 100 miles by truck in emissions
goldenInsights.suggestedUse: counter-intuitive fact for transport modes section

goldenInsights.insight: Global potato trade hit record EUR 24.5 billion in 2024
goldenInsights.suggestedUse: shows scale and importance of topic

differentiation.primaryDifferentiator: Three-stage transportation framework (pre-process, during-process, post-process) combined with economic context competitors lack

irreplicableInsights.insight: Truckers report 7+ hours to cool bulk potatoes; cleanup costs $120+
$298M annual bruising cost to U.S. industry
Crisp potatoes travel farthest (1,000+ km), starch shortest (150 km)

avoidList: Generic temperature tables without explaining WHY

research.coreThesis: Understanding how potatoes travel from farm to table reveals why proper handling at every stage matters - not just for quality, but for the economics of a $26.5 billion global industry

cautious: Specific transit time estimates - use ranges

structure: What Are the Three Stages of Potato Transportation?
How Do Trucks, Trains, and Ships Move Potatoes?
What Temperature and Conditions Do Potatoes Need During Transport?
What Challenges Do Potato Transporters Face?
How Is Bruising Prevented During Transport?

opinionsIncluded: Three Stages: 'I recommend thinking in these three stages rather than memorizing individual specifications'
